sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Calls are growing for frozen Russian assets to be used to fund the rebuilding of Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Israel's military has destroyed what it called a rocket-launching compound in Gaza, fueling fears of an escalation in the war.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: President Zelensky has been using his time in Davos to push several issues linked to the war with Russia.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: He has called for some of the Russian billions seized by international banks to be sent to rebuild Ukraine, with around $350 billion worth of Russian assets currently frozen.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The idea has backing from the UK, and David Cameron is pressuring Western governments to agree.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: The way to think about it is we've already frozen those assets. The question is what should we do next? And I think there's a legal argument, a moral argument and a political argument. When Putin launched this illegal invasion, the world changed and we have to change with it and recognise we are in a more dangerous, uncertain and difficult world.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: And so we should be prepared to do some innovative thinking about how we use these resources to help Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: We need frozen assets, not frozen conflict.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: This is the way forward.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: This is the way forward to send a clear message to everyone in the world that if you dare to break rules you're going to pay last week russian foreign ministry spokeswoman maria zakharova said that u.s proposals to confiscate up to 300 billion dollars in frozen russian assets to help rebuild ukraine was 21st century piracy ukraine clearly needs the money the The massive damage to agriculture, energy, transport, construction, the list goes on, has been put in the $1 trillion region and counting.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: But the idea of confiscating Russian assets has bankers in Europe concerned that a difficult legal precedent could be set and could undermine global financial stability.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: global financial stability. Israel's military has destroyed what it called a rocket launching compound in the Gaza Strip.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The operation comes the day after 50 rockets were fired at the southern Israeli city of Netivot on Tuesday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: A shipment of medicine for Israeli hostages and Palestinian civilians also entered the Gaza Strip under a deal mediated by Qatar and France.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The agreement marks a significant development in indirect cooperation between Israel and Hamas since December following a short-lived ceasefire.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: On Wednesday, Israel's Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu visited an airbase and repeated his pledge that Israel will continue the war in Gaza until Hamas is eliminated.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: But more than 100 days into the conflict, Palestinian authorities say the death toll has passed 24,400, fears of a potential second front in the war took a turn for the worse after Israel killed several people, including someone it claimed was the head of terrorist infrastructure.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Support for Hamas in the Palestinian-run region is said to be soaring with accusations that the casualties were civilians, among them four brothers.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Polish truckers have agreed with government to suspend protests that have blocked border

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: crossings with Ukraine since November.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: They're angry at the unequal treatment of carriers.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Protests will stop for nearly two months whilst talks are still ongoing.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: When Russia invaded Ukraine, permits were waived to help Ukrainian hauliers, but their Polish counterparts said the move created unfair competition and took a toll on their earnings.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Although the Polish drivers say they will remain steadfast in their demands, they are willing to give the country's new government a chance.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: We gave the government and our Poland this time until March 1st, so that we could just sit and check what they managed to do for us.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The small success is that from the side of the Ukrainian cars that enter Poland, they żebyśmy po prostu siedli i sprawdzili co im się udało dla nas zrobić. Mały sukces jest w tym, że ze strony ukraińskiej samochody, które wjeżdżają do Polski są już wyłączane z tej czerwi i mogą się rejestrować do godziny 20 i wyjadą z Ukrainy w pierwszej kolejności.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Także tutaj już widać pierwsze akty dobrej woli ze strony ukraińskiej.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Europe and the West need to urgently ramp up arms production capacity to support Ukraine's

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: fight against Russia and to ensure its own defense.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: That's the view of Poland's foreign affairs minister, Radek Sikorski.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Speaking to Euronews at the World Economic Forum in Davos, Sikorski said Poland was increasing its military budget but said Europe as a whole wasn't producing enough weapons. In our military budget, 50% is now spent on procurement of weapons and ammunition.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: And we are looking at ways of boosting our production of armored personnel carriers, mortars, and above all, ammunition.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: We have a European line of finance for ammunition for Ukraine and for ourselves.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: But the bottleneck, I understand, is sheer production capacity, and we need to urgently increase that.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Sikorsky said the West had underestimated the threat posed by Russia, but that it was more than capable to defend itself. VLADIMIR PUTIN, President, United Nations Council on the Rights of the People of Russia and the United Nations Council on the Rights of the People of Russia Russia, under the current leadership, only seems to respect strength, and we need to restore that strength.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: We are economically 20 times richer than Russia.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Within my lifetime, Russia, as the Soviet Union, took on the whole West and lost.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: It will lose again. East Poland ready in case Russia tries to leave.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: was the existential threats posed by runaway climate chaos and the runaway development of AI without guardrails.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: End quote.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Those are the words of the UN Secretary General, Antonio Guterres, when he spoke in the main Congress hall on Wednesday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Reflecting on the COP28 in Dubai, he called for the phasing out of fossil fuels, said it was essential and inevitable.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: For his view on whether the fossil fuel industry should be part of the talks when it comes to phasing out their type of oil, and on the fact that the COP29 in Azerbaijan will have a committee just made up by women.

sentences.sentence: We spoke to Wupke Hukstra.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: He's the new EU Climate Commissioner in charge of climate action.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: So the only thing, from my perspective, we should judge the next COP on is results.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Is the results a significant step in the right direction, particularly in the realm of finance, which that COP will be all about.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Meanwhile, on Wednesday in Davos, European leaders like the French President Emmanuel Macron and the Spanish Premier Pedro Sánchez took a break from domestic national woes to woo the world of tech and big business here in Davos, giving lengthy speeches with the French President Emmanuel Macron calling for a much stronger European Union, for better cooperation and collaboration globally, and also for innovation.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Thursday now we'll see a little bit of a wind-down of the numerous talks that have been taking place throughout the week, but there will be one very interesting discussion on anxiety, which really is interesting considering our conversations earlier this week in Davos with the founder of a youth organization, Think Young, that represents young people from all across the world who believe that anxiety and mental health are one of the key issues now for young people.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: And that's what they'll be thinking of when they go to vote in the European elections this June.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Maeve McMahon, Euronews, Davos. The European Commission is closely watching the developments of the Polish state broadcaster

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: and is ready to act if needed.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: EU Commission Vice President Vera Jourova told Euronews in Davos.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The new pro-European government, led by Donald Tusk, sacked the managers of the public TV and radio in a bid to depoliticise the national media.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: The move resulted in mass protests by the opposition and condemnation by the Polish president Andrzej Duda who has ties to the previous government. Of course, we are always worried when we see the changes in the public media, and that's why I proposed the Media Freedom Act.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: But the Media Freedom Act is not still in force.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: This is what I tried to explain today to President Duda, that we cannot act within our competencies without having the law.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: And so, again, we are watching, we are very closely also assessing what's happening in Poland in the field of media.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: And in case there is a contradiction with the existing EU law, then we will have to act.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Fiori Rova also demanded further action from Hungary after Budapest submitted its justice reforms in order to freeze EU funding.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: In December, the Commission unblocked 10 billion euros for Hungary in cohesion funds, a move widely criticised by MEPs.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: In 2022, the EU blocked most of the money for Hungary because of serious rule of law backsliding and corruption risks.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: There are a lot of issues in Hungary.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: It's not only judiciary, it's also the media freedom, it's the academic freedom, it's the system which we see where the state equals the party and party has big power.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: And so this was the reason why we blocked quite a lot of money.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: And now to unblock the money means that Hungary has to do concrete things.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Hungary did some things.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: They introduced some changes in the judiciary system so we unblocked part of the money but still a lot of funding has been waiting for another further action by Hungary.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: On Thursday in Strasbourg, the European Parliament will vote on a resolution threatening the European Commission with legal action if they proceed in allocating more money to Hungary.
